subject: Writing
title: Alphabets vs. Syllabaries vs. Logographies
description: Learn Alphabets vs. Syllabaries vs. Logographies in one minute.

hook.text: English uses 26 letters. Japanese uses three writing systems at once. Chinese uses thousands of characters.

buildup.text: Writing systems come in three main types: alphabets, syllabaries, and logographies.

discovery.text: Alphabets map letters to sounds. Syllabaries map symbols to syllables. Logographies map symbols to meanings.

twist.text: Most systems are hybrids â€” English uses alphabetic letters but 'logographic' symbols like $, &, and @.

climax.text: No system is objectively better â€” each evolved to fit its language's structure and its culture's needs.

punchline.text: There's no best way to write. Just different ways to think.

quiz.question: What is the difference between an alphabet and a syllabary?
options: Alphabets map letters to sounds; syllabaries map symbols to syllables
Syllabaries are always older than alphabets
